intro: Solanum fasciatum, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple color, containing seeds within a fleshy pulp. Solanum fasciatum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
